contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Governor |name= Frank W. Hunt |image=Frankwhunt.PNG |caption= |order=5th |office= Governor of Idaho |term_start=January 7, 1901 |term_end=January 5, 1903 |lieutenant=[[Thomas F. Terrell]] |predecessor=[[Frank Steunenberg]] |successor=[[John T. Morrison]] |birth_date={{Birth date|1861|12|16|mf=y}}<ref>[http://books.google.ca/books?id=gawYAAAAIAAJ&q=%22Hunt,+frank+williams%22+1861&dq=%22Hunt,+frank+williams%22+1861&hl=en&sa=X&ei=MefsUKudM8OQiQKo8ICoDg&ved=0CFMQ6AEwBg]</ref> |birth_place=[[Newport, Kentucky|Newport]], [[Kentucky]] |death_date={{Death date and age|1906|11|25|1861|12|16}} |death_place=[[Boise, Idaho|Boise]], [[Idaho]] |spouse=Ruth Maynard |profession=[[Mining]], [[military]] |residence=[[Emmett, Idaho|Emmett]] |party= [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrat]] |religion=[[Episcopal Church in the United States of America|Episcopalian]] |footnotes= }} '''Frank Williams Hunt''' (December 16, 1861 – November 25, 1906) was the [[List of Governors of Idaho|fifth Governor]] of [[Idaho]] from 1901 until 1903. ==Biography== Hunt was educated in the common schools of Louisville, Kentucky. He moved to Idaho, pursued work as a miner, and was married to Ruth Maynard on November 10, 1896.<ref>{{cite web|title=Frank W. Hunt|url=http://politicalgraveyard.com/bio/hunt.html|publisher=The Political Graveyard|accessdate=15 September 2012}}</ref> ==Career== Elected to the Idaho State House of Representatives in 1892, Hunt held that position until 1894.<ref>{{cite web|title=Frank W. Hunt|url=http://www.nga.org/cms/home/governors/past-governors-bios/page_idaho/col2-content/main-content-list/title_hunt_frank.html|publisher=National Governors Association|accessdate=15 September 2012}}</ref> Hunt served as a [[Captain (land)|captain]] in the Idaho Regiment of Volunteers in the [[Philippines]] during the [[Spanish-American War]] (1898).<ref>{{cite web|title=Frank W. Hunt|url=http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=12352683|publisher=Find A Grave|accessdate=15 September 2012}}</ref> Elected governor in 1900 at the age of 38 Hunt remains the youngest governor in Idaho history.In March 1901 Hunt signed legislation creating the Academy of Idaho (now [[Idaho State University]]) in [[Pocatello, Idaho|Pocatello]]. Hunt also ended the state of [[martial law]] in northern Idaho enacted by his predecessor, [[Frank Steunenberg]], in 1899 as a response to labor unrest. Hunt was defeated for reelection in 1902 by [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] [[John T. Morrison]]. After leaving office he became vice president and general manager of Dewey Combination Lease Company. ==Death== Late in 1906 Hunt contracted [[pneumonia]] in Goldfield, Nevada and died on November 25, in Boise, Idaho, at the age of 44.<ref>{{cite web|title=Frank W. Hunt|url=http://politicalgraveyard.com/bio/hunt.html|publisher=The Political Graveyard|accessdate=15 September 2012}}</ref> He is buried in Boise in the [http://www.cityofboise.org/Departments/Parks/Cemeteries/Pioneer_walking_tour/page3815.aspx Pioneer Cemetery] (which has become known as "The Masonic Cemetery") Boise, Ada County, Idaho USA.<ref>{{cite web|title=Frank W. Hunt|url=http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=12352683|publisher=Find A Grave|accessdate=15 September 2012}}</ref> The [http://www.gemcountymuseum.org/complex.html Gem County Museum] in Emmett includes an exhibit of his belongings. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category}} <!-- for current and future use if material is uploaded --> *[http://www.nga.org/cms/home/governors/past-governors-bios/page_idaho/col2-content/main-content-list/title_hunt_frank.html National Governors Association] *[http://politicalgraveyard.com/bio/hunt.html The Political Graveyard] *[http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=12352683 Find A Grave] <br/><!--this break is to put visual space between the last information and thfollowing template if needed--> {{Governors of Idaho}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Hunt, Frank W. | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = December 16, 1861 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Newport, Kentucky|Newport]], [[Kentucky]] | DATE OF DEATH = November 25, 1906 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Boise, Idaho|Boise]], [[Idaho]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hunt, Frank W.}} [[Category:1861 births]] [[Category:1906 deaths]] [[Category:American military personnel of the Spanishâ€“American War]] [[Category:Governors of Idaho]] [[Category:American Episcopalians]] [[Category:American people of English descent]] [[Category:United States Army officers]] [[Category:People from Newport, Kentucky]] [[Category:Democratic Party state governors of the United States]] [[Category:Idaho Democrats]]
